questions.name: new_school_registration_monitoring_update
questions.label: New school registration or monitoring update?

tooltip.text: Entry of school data in RTMIS (first time) or update of monitoring data (existing school)

questions.name: school_geolocation
questions.label: Geolocation of school

questions.name: school_respondent_role
questions.label: School respondent: role/position

tooltip.text: List of school positions/roles

questions.name: school_respondent_role_other
questions.label: Other (Please specify)

questions.name: total_students_enrolled
questions.label: Total number of students enrolled in school

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the total number of students currently enrolled in this school?

questions.name: num_boys_enrolled
questions.label: Number of boys (male students) enrolled in school

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the total number of boys currently enrolled in this school?

questions.name: num_girls_enrolled
questions.label: Number of girls (female students) enrolled in school

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the total number of girls currently enrolled in this school?

questions.name: num_students_disability
questions.label: Number of students with disability enrolled in school

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: what is the total number of students with disability currently enrolled in this school?

question_groups.name: school_location
question_groups.label: School: Location
question_groups.description: This question contains a list of possible school locations, starting with the government area or district, down to the community.

questions.name: school_location
questions.label: What is the location of the school?

tooltip.text: This question contains a list of possible school locations, starting with the government area or district, down to the community.

questions.name: school
questions.label: School Cascade

questions.name: main_drinking_water_source
questions.label: Main source of drinking water

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: what is the main source of drinking water for the school?
Main source: if there is more than one water source, select the one used most frequently for drinking water

questions.name: main_drinking_water_source_other
questions.label: Other (Please specify)

questions.name: num_water_points
questions.label: Number of water points

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: how many drinking water points (e.g. taps) are available to students at the school?
Number of water points: count the total number of drinking water points available to students at the school

questions.name: drinking_water_availability_current
questions.label: Drinking water availability: current

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: is drinking water from the main water source currently available at the school?
Currently available: drinking water is available at the time of the interview, either from the main source directly or stored water originally from the main source

questions.name: drinking_water_availability_school_year
questions.label: Drinking water availability: throughout school year

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: is drinking water typically available throughout the school year?
Throughout the school year: drinking water is available throughout the school year, when the students are at school

options.label: No (unavailable for more than 30 days in total)
Mostly (unavailable for up to 30 days in total)

questions.name: drinking_water_treatment
questions.label: Drinking water treatment

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE & INTERVIEW: what treatment method is used ot make the water from the main source safe to drink?
SODIS: solar disinfection (plastic bottles placed in sun for a number of hours)

questions.name: water_accessibility_students_lim_mobility_vision
questions.label: Drinking water accessibility: students with limited mobility or vision

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is drinking water accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
Accessible: drinking water can be accessed (directly from the source or from a storage container) via a clear path without stairs or steps that is free of obstruction and has age-appropriate handrails; the tap can be reached from a seated position; and the water source/dispsenser can be opened and closed with minimal effort with one closed fist or foot

questions.name: water_accessibility_smallest_students
questions.label: Drinking water accessibility: smallest students

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is drinking water accessible to the smallest children at the school?
Accessible: drinking water can be reached (directly from the source or from a storage container) and the water source/dispenser can be easily opened and closed by the smallest children

questions.name: school_toilet_interface_type
questions.label: Main type of school toilet: interface

tooltip.text: Main type: the most common type of school toilet should be selected Toilet interface examples: 1. Dry latrine with hole in floor 2. Pour-flush pan 3. SATO pan.

options.label: Hole in floor (VIP latrine with vent pipe)
Flush or pour-flush pan with water seal
Open pipe to pit (no water seal)

questions.name: school_toilet_containment_collection_system
questions.label: Main type of school toilet: pit, tank or connection

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: main type of excreta containment or collection system
Main type: the most common type of student toilet should be selected
Containment system: pit or tank (or other) that contains and stores excreta
Collection system: connection through which excreta and wastewater are collected
Examples: 1. Latrine pit; 2. Septic tank; 3. Sewer connection.
Flush to don't know: household does not know where the toilet flushes to, but no surface outlets or open discharges are visible (in this case, likely to be a buried pit or tank)

options.label: No pit or tank (discharge to open: field, open drain, water body, elsewhere)

questions.name: durable_toilet_slabs
questions.label: School toilet: durable slabs

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: durable toilet slabs observed in school toilets?
Durable toilet slab: toilet slab or floor is made from durable materials.
Examples of durable toilet slabs: 1. Concrete toilet slab; 2. Concrete toilet slab covered with ceramic tiles; 3. Structural plastic slab.

options.label: All school toilet slabs are NOT durable
Some school toilet slabs are NOT durable
All functional school toilets have durable toilet slabs

questions.name: durable_toilet_pits
questions.label: School toilet: durable pits

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: durable toilet pits observed in school toilets?
OBSERVE: are there any signs of collapse or damage to the school toilet containment or collection system?
INTERVIEW (where containment not visible): were any materials used to support the sides of the containment system?
INTERVIEW (where containment not visible): does the soil collapse without support?
INTERVIEW (where containment not visible): has the toilet pit collapsed in the last 12 months?
Durable toilet containment (in stable soils): unlined pits may be assessed as durable in areas where other unlined pits are known to be stable and long-lasting.
Durable toilet containment (in UNSTABLE soils): the pit or tank should either be lined with durable materials (e.g. concrete, brickwork, blockwork), or lined with resilient local materials approved by the county public health office for pit linings.

options.label: All toilet pits are NOT durable
Some toilet pits are NOT durable
All functional toilet pits are durable

questions.name: num_girls_only_functional_toilet
questions.label: Number of functional girls-only school toilets

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: count the number of FUNCTIONAL girls-only toilets. Functional: toilet is not broken, toilet hole is not blocked, and water is available for flushing (where required).

questions.name: num_girls_only_non_functional_toilet
questions.label: Number of NON-functional girls-only school toilets

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: count the number of NON-FUNCTIONAL girls-only toilets. Functional: toilet is broken, toilet hole is blocked, and water is not available for flushing (where required).

questions.name: num_boys_only_functional_toilets
questions.label: Number of functional boys-only school toilets

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: count the number of FUNCTIONAL boys-only toilets. Functional: toilet is not broken, toilet hole is not blocked, and water is available for flushing (where required).

questions.name: num_boys_only_non_functional_toilet
questions.label: Number of NON-functional boys-only school toilets

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: count the number of NON-FUNCTIONAL boys-only toilets. Functional: toilet is broken, toilet hole is blocked, and water is not available for flushing (where required).

questions.name: num_functional_shared_toilet
questions.label: Number of functional SHARED toilet

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: count the number of FUNCTIONAL shared toilets. Functional: toilet is not broken, toilet hole is not blocked, and water is available for flushing (where required).

questions.name: num_non_functional_shared_toilet
questions.label: Number of NON-functional SHARED toilet

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: count the number of NON-FUNCTIONAL shared toilets. Functional: toilet is broken, toilet hole is blocked, and water is not available for flushing (where required).

questions.name: girl_student_toilet_ratio
questions.label: Girl student-toilet ratio

tooltip.text: Girl student-toilet ratio: total number of girls (female students) enrolled in the school divided by the total number of functional girls-only toilets (segregated).

fn.fnString: #num_girls_only_functional_toilet# > 0 ? (#num_girls_enrolled# / #num_girls_only_functional_toilet#) > 25 ? "More than 25 girl students to each functional girls' toilet": "25 or less girl students to each functional girls' toilet": "No Toilet"

questions.name: boy_student_toilet_ratio
questions.label: Boy student-toilet ratio

tooltip.text: Boy student-toilet ratio: total number of boys (male students) enrolled in the school divided by the total number of functional toilets (available to boys only plus shared toilets available to all students).

fn.fnString: #num_boys_only_functional_toilets# > 0 && #num_functional_shared_toilet# > 0 ? ( #num_boys_enrolled# / ( #num_boys_only_functional_toilets# + #num_functional_shared_toilet# )) > 30 ? "More than 30 boy students to each functional boys' or shared toilet": "30 or less boy students to each functional boys' or shared toilet":  "No Toilet"

questions.name: flyproof_school_toilets
questions.label: Flyproof school toilets

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are the school toilets flyproof?
Flyproof: toilet design prevents flies from reaching the excreta in the pit (or other containment system).
Examples of flyproof toilets: 1. Pour-flush pit latrine with a functional water-seal pan; 2. VIP latrine with a screened vent pipe; 3. Dry pit latrine with a tight-fitting drophole cover.
Examples of NON-flyproof toilets: 1. Pour-flush latrine with dry water seal (no water); VIP latrine with NO insect screen on vent pipe; 3. Pit latrine with inadequate or missing drophole cover.
Inadequate drophole cover: a cover that is not tight-fitting enough to prevent fly or insect entry into the pit

options.label: All school toilets are NOT flyproof
Some school toilets are NOT flyproof
All functional school toilets are flyproof

questions.name: school_toilet_privacy
questions.label: School toilet privacy

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: do toilet superstructures provide privacy?
Privacy: toilet superstructure has walls and a door that allow use of the toilet without observation by people outside the toilet, with closable doors that lock from the inside and no large openings in the toilet structure.

options.label: All school toilets provide INADEQUATE privacy
Some school toilets provide INADEQUATE privacy
All functional school toilets provide good privacy

questions.name: school_toilet_availability
questions.label: School toilet availability

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are school toilets available for use by students?
Available to students: toilet doors are unlocked, or a key is available to students at all times.

options.label: All school toilets UNAVAILABLE to students
Some school toilets UNAVAILABLE to students
All functional school toilets available to students

questions.name: clean_school_toilets
questions.label: Clean school toilets

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: are the school toilets clean?
Clean: toilets do not have a strong smell; there are not significant numbers of flies or mosquitoes in the toilets; and there are no visible faeces or soiled cleaning materials on the toilet floors, walls, seats (or pans).
Somewhat clean: toilets have some smell and/or some trace of faecal matter or soiled cleansing materials in some of the toilets
NOT clean: there is a strong smell and/or presence of faecal matter or soiled cleansing materials in most toilets

options.label: All functional school toilets are clean

questions.name: no_exposed_excreta_around_school_toilets
questions.label: No exposed human excreta around school toilets

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: visible human faeces around the school toilets or in the school buildings or compound.

options.label: No visible OD or human excreta

questions.name: safely_managed_toilet_containment_wastewater
questions.label: Safely managed: wastewater contained in pit (or tank)

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: any evidence of surface outflows from pits or tanks
Surface outflows from pits or tanks: EITHER continuous outflows of faecal sludge or wastewater from overflow pipes, holes or leaks; OR evidence of previous surface outflows (for example, increased vegetation growth around the pits, or visible sludge deposits from overflows or leaks)

options.label: Evidence of previous surface outflows from containment
Safely managed wastewater: no surface outflows

questions.name: safely_managed_toilet_containment_faecal_sludge
questions.label: Safely managed: excreta contained in pit (or tank)

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: have the school toilet pits or tanks ever been emptied? INTERVIEW: have the school toilet pits or tanks ever filled up? INTERVIEW: what happened the last time the school toilet pits or tanks filled up?

options.label: Emptied to open pit or open space
Emptied to UNLICENSED or UNKNOWN location
Stored for less than 2 years before use of stored waste
Never emptied, previous pit or tank replaced when full
Stored for MORE than 2 years before use of stored waste
Emptied to nearby covered pit (buried within community)

questions.name: school_toilet_accessibility_students_lim_mobility_vision
questions.label: School toilet accessibility: students with limited mobility or vision

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is there at least one functional toilet accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
Accessible: the toilet can be accessed via a clear path without stairs or steps that is free of obstructions and has age-appropriate handrails; there is enough space inside for a wheelchair user to enter, turn, close the door and park by the toilet; the door is wide enough for a wheelchair (at least 80cm) and opens outward with minimal or no difference in floor height between outside and inside; and the door handle and seat are within reach of students using wheelchairs, crutches or sticks, including a fixed raised pan or movable raised toilet seat to accommodate students who may have difficulty squatting

questions.name: school_toilet_accessibility_smallest_students
questions.label: School toilet accessibility: smallest students

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is there at least one functional toilet accessible to the smallest children at the school?
Accessible: the toilet can be used by the smallest children, including (where necessary) a smaller toilet drophole, a lower seat, and a lower door handle.

questions.name: main_location_school_handwashing_facilities
questions.label: Main location of school handwashing facilities

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: where are school handwashing facilities located?
Location: main location for functional handwashing facilities

options.label: Handwashing facilities in food preparation area
Handwashing facilities in food consumption/dining area

questions.name: num_school_handwashing_facilities
questions.label: Number of school handwashing facilities

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: how many school handwashing facilities are available? Available: functional handwashing facility that enables students to wash their hands using running water, such as a basin with tap, water tank with tap,
bucket with tap, tippy tap, or other similar device.
NB a shared bucket or basin used for dipping hands is NOT considered an acceptable handwashing facility.

questions.name: water_availability_school_handwashing_facilities
questions.label: Water availability at school handwashing facilities

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is water available at school handwashing facilities?
Water: where soapy water is used for handwashing, non-soapy water must also be available for rinsing hands after washing

options.label: Water NOT available at some handwashing facilities
All handwashing facilities have water available

questions.name: soap_availability_school_handwashing_facilities
questions.label: Soap availability at school handwashing facilities

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is soap available at school handwashing facilities?
Soap: solid, liquid or powder soap or detergent

options.label: No soap or other cleanser available
Some handwashing facilities have soap available
All handwashing facilities have soap available

questions.name: school_handwashing_facility_type
questions.label: School handwashing facility type

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: what is the main type of school handwashing station available?
Permanent handwashing station: facility made from durable materials, with a piped water connection or adequate water storage, and located in a fixed place that is appropriate for handwashing by students
Temporary handwashing facility: tippy tap or other facility made from non-durable materials
Portable basin: open container that can be picked up and moved

options.label: Portable basins or other open containers
Permanent handwashing stations with adequate water storage

questions.name: hands_free_operation_school_handwashing_facility
questions.label: Hands-free use of school handwashing facility

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: mechanisms to collect water or trigger water flow
Hands-free operation: handwashing stations are operated by tap, or other hands-free mechanism that minimises contact with the water collection device and the water container

options.label: Water collected using tool (ladle, cup, other)
Closed water storage containers with taps

questions.name: adequate_drainage_washing_water
questions.label: Drainage of washing water

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: facilities to collect washing water, and facilities to drain and dispose of the washing water
Collection of washing water: containers to collect dirty washing water (for example, a basin or other container)
Drainage and disposal of washing water: drainage pipes or other facilities to direct the washing water to appropriate disposal points (for example, soakpits or drains)

options.label: No collection or disposal of washing water
Collection of washing water without good drainage or disposal
Safe collection and disposal of washing water

questions.name: handwashing_accessibility_students_lim_mobility_vision
questions.label: Handwashing accessibility: students with limited mobility or vision

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is there at least one handwashing facility accessible to those with limited mobility or vision?
Accessible: the handwashing facility can be accessed via a clear path without stairs or steps that is free of obstructions and has age-appropriate handrails; the tap and soap are reachable from a seated position, and the tap can be operated by feet and/or one closed fist with minimal effort

questions.name: handwashing_accessibility_smallest_students
questions.label: Handwashing accessibility: smallest students

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: is there at least one handwashing facility accessible to the smallest children at the school?
Accessible: the smallest children are able to reach the tap and soap, and able to operate the tap on their own with minimal effort

questions.name: private_bathing_areas_menstrual_hygiene
questions.label: Private bathing areas for menstrual hygiene

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: bathing areas adequate for menstrual hygiene
Adequate bathing area: private and girls-only place for washing and menstrual hygiene, with closable doors that lock from the inside, without the possibility of observation by people outside the bathing area

options.label: Private bathing areas for menstrual hygiene

questions.name: water_soap_available_menstrual_hygiene_bathing_areas
questions.label: Water and soap available in bathing areas for menstrual hygiene

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: water and soap available in bathing areas

options.label: Water and soap are NOT available in bathing areas
Some bathing areas have water and soap available
All bathing areas have both water and soap available

questions.name: clean_bathing_areas_menstrual_hygiene
questions.label: Clean bathing areas for menstrual hygiene

tooltip.text:
OBSERVE: clean bathing areas available for menstrual hygiene
Clean bathing areas: the places available for washing and menstrual hygiene are clean

options.label: All bathing areas are NOT clean
Some bathing areas are NOT clean
Clean bathing areas for menstrual hygiene

questions.name: availability_menstrual_hygiene_materials_school
questions.label: Availability of menstrual hygiene materials at the school

tooltip.text:
INTERVIEW: are menstrual hygiene materials available at the school?
Menstrual hygiene materials and products: disposable and reusable sanitary pads, tampons, and resuable menstrual cups, clean piece of cotton cloth or cotton wool, that are safe and hygienic, and absorb or collect blood during menstrual periods.
Available: menstrual hygiene materials are currently available at the school (via free distribution or for purchase).

options.label: Materials are NOT available or NOT appropriate
Materials are not always available or appropriate

questions.name: disposal_facilities_menstrual_hygiene_wastes
questions.label: Disposal facilities for menstrual hygiene wastes

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: are covered bins available for disposal of menstrual hygiene wastes?

options.label: All bathing areas have covered bins available for menstrual hygiene wastes

questions.name: disposal_system_menstrual_hygiene_wastes
questions.label: Disposal system for menstrual hygiene wastes

tooltip.text: OBSERVE: how are menstrual hygiene wastes (in covered bins) collected and disposed?

options.label: Emptied to open pits, open space, open water bodies, open drains
Collected by municpal waste system/licensed service providers

questions.name: menstrual_hygiene_education
questions.label: Menstrual hygiene education

tooltip.text: INTERVIEW: is menstrual hygiene management education available at the school?</br>
